```markdown
# micromark-util-sanitize-uri

[![Build Status](https://github.com/micromark/micromark/workflows/main/badge.svg)](https://github.com/micromark/micromark/actions)
[![Coverage Status](https://img.shields.io/codecov/c/github/micromark/micromark.svg)](https://codecov.io/github/micromark/micromark)

[![Bundle Size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/minzip/micromark-util-sanitize-uri)](https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=micromark-util-sanitize-uri)
[![Sponsors](https://opencollective.com/unified/sponsors/badge.svg)](https://opencollective.com/unified)
[![Backers](https://opencollective.com/unified/backers/badge.svg)](https://opencollective.com/unified)
[![Chat](https://img.shields.io/badge/chat-discussions-success.svg)](https://github.com/micromark/micromark/discussions)

A utility for sanitizing URLs for use in `micromark` extensions.  This helps prevent malicious code injection.

## Installation

This package is ESM-only.

```bash
npm install micromark-util-sanitize-uri
```

Or, for use in Deno with `esm.sh`:

```typescript
import {sanitizeUri} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-sanitize-uri@latest';
```

Or, in a browser using `esm.sh`:

```html
<script type="module">
  import {sanitizeUri} from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-sanitize-uri@latest?bundle';
</script>
```

## Usage

```typescript
import {sanitizeUri} from 'micromark-util-sanitize-uri';

console.log(sanitizeUri('https://example.com/a&b')); // Output: https://example.com/a&amp;b
console.log(sanitizeUri('javascript:alert(1)'));    // Output: (empty string) - blocked by default
console.log(sanitizeUri('https://example.com/a%b'));  // Output: https://example.com/a%25b
console.log(sanitizeUri('./example.jpg', /^https?$/i)); // Output: ./example.jpg
console.log(sanitizeUri('https://example.com/üëç')); // Output: https://example.com/%F0%9F%91%8D
```

## API

This module exports the following functions:

### `sanitizeUri(url, [pattern])`

Sanitizes a URL string, preventing injection of malicious code.

*   **`url`**: The URL string to sanitize.
*   **`pattern` (optional, RegExp)**: A regular expression defining allowed protocols.  If provided, only URLs matching the pattern will be considered valid and sanitized.  Use this to restrict the protocols allowed for certain use cases.

Returns the sanitized URL string, or an empty string if the URL is invalid based on the `pattern`.  

**Example (restricts to HTTPS):**

```javascript
const sanitizedUrl = sanitizeUri('https://example.com/path', /^https$/i);
console.log(sanitizedUrl); // Output: https://example.com/path
```


## Security Considerations

This package helps mitigate URL injection vulnerabilities.  Always ensure that user-provided URLs are sanitized before using them in your application.  For complete security, verify the URL structure beyond simply ensuring the protocol matches your whitelist.
